page.title: 15THELWALL'S SUPERNATURAL TALE
page.content:
The Little Manor in Thelwall was built in 1642 for a General in Oliver Cromwell's army. He lived there for many years until tragedy overtook his family in the form of his death at the hands of the housemaid whom he loved.
She murdered him in the porchway during a fit of rage when he tried to disentangle himself from her affections. Overcome by remorse, she then hanged herself on a tall fir tree in the driveway.
It is common knowledge with the local people that the HOTEL is{haunted by the{ghost}of this young woman whose name was Rachel. There is even a bar named after her at the Little Manor Public House.
